website_summaries.verdict: Choose this one if you want a coffee maker by Chemex that conveniently holds just enough coffee for two to three people; but if you prefer the classic series, you may miss those models' looks and features.
pros: A good choice for individuals who prefer a small coffee maker with a convenient handle
Holds up to 3 cups of coffee
cons: No wood collar or leather tie that many users like about classic models by Chemex

customer_reviews.title: Super fragile
customer_reviews.text: I had my first Chemex for over a year before a friend accidentally dropped it. But before that, it had knocked into other items several times and came out unharmed. I bought a replacement, and it broke within the first week from a very light graze. The third one I bought came in a million pieces, but the packaging was unharmed. Sorry, Chemex. I am moving on!
customer_reviews.author: Glenda M.

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love it! ❤️
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had learned about Chemex years ago. After a week of coffee made with it, I'll never go back. It's so delicious! I use less sugar, and drink every drop. Try folding a couple of weeks worth of filters in advance, they are easy to fold and then they are ready. I use a hand cranked burr grinder and a kettle with a long spout, both of which are worth having anyway, but combined with the Chemex, I can make a perfect cup every time.
customer_reviews.author: YashasMom

customer_reviews.title: the balance when pouring is better
customer_reviews.text: I loved the Chemex style of the collar and the beads, the quality of the glass, and used it for a couple years. But glass breaks for clumsy people, (I knocked it over onto a granite counter) and i needed a replacement. this style is better because it pours easier. the balance is better. there is no collar to remove while cleaning. if you leave that collar on while cleaning, it discolors. After several uses, clean this with salt and water, swirling for several minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Baralt

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but buy elsewhere!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a Chemex (6 cups, wood collar) for a few months and it makes the best cup of coffee I've ever had. I figured I would get one for my mother as well. However, Amazon's packaging did not account for the fact that this product is made of glass: The Chemex arrived completely broken, with the top half shattered into a million pieces. Returned to Amazon and ordered a new one from Williams and Sonoma. Their packaging was much sturdier, and now my mom is enjoying cups of smooth Chemex coffee every morning. Great product, but buy elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Gatsby

customer_reviews.title: just to look for the best cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: Everyone stop looking for a coffee maker. I have purchase so many coffee maker, just to look for the best cup of coffee. When I stumbled on this one. I have decided to give it a try because i am not please with the other one's I have purchased, from expensive to cheap one's. Trust me when I tell you this one makes the best I have ever tasted, and it is so simple to make and wash. I do not know why, maybe is it's filter, but it does a great job. I will purchase a larger one just in case family or guest cime over.
customer_reviews.author: Edwards

customer_reviews.title: The Handle Makes the Difference
customer_reviews.text: Better than the more popular Chemex with the rawhide strings. (The rawhide look may be cooler to look at, but for practicality, this glass-handled container is much less likely to burn your fingers): As most of you already know, if you don't take utmost care to grab the rawhide strings when picking up the container, you will get burned by the glass itself. Less likely with a cool, easy to use handle in the same glass container that we all know and love to make that perfect cup of coffee.

As for the time it takes vs a traditional coffee maker is not a big deal for me, now know the exact amount of coffee and water to use so it's a quick process. Grind your own beans...makes it even better!

customer_reviews.title: coffe the way it was meant to be made
customer_reviews.text: This is the way to get a truly wonderful cup of coffee. By using the Chemex and water straight off the boil from the tea kettle I and not only obtain the correct temperature, I can also make sure that all the grinds are being equally saturated, something that auto drip electric coffee makers also fall short of. It takes up no counter space, looks like modern art in glass form, and the handle is so much better than their other models that require trying to grip the wooden collar. The handle stays cool to the touch.

customer_reviews.title: Better than wooden collar model
customer_reviews.text: I bought this version of the Chemex with the glass handle because of another review here on Amazon. Very glad that I did as this version is so easy to clean after use. I will admit, the glass is a bit thinner than I would have thought it would be, so it may not hold up over time as the occasional bump can't be avoided in the kitchen. But as of now I love the product and my coffee has never tasted better!
customer_reviews.author: J.H. Keenan

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: Not as thrilled as after a week using it still trying to figure out how to make coffee strong without having to put two filters and a lot of grounds but working on it and it's a nice holder for coffee and pretty, may move back to the ceramic cone soon though.
customer_reviews.author: Sat333

customer_reviews.title: Makes great tasting coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Have used Chemex pour over for 30 years! For me it’s the best tasting coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard L. Marrujo

customer_reviews.title: This is better, easier to use and easier to clean
customer_reviews.text: We have been making coffee with an aeropress. This is better, easier to use and easier to clean. Most importantly, it tastes better too.
customer_reviews.author: Yuanxiao X.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, but broke after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: It is every bit as good as it's reputation demands. However, I bought it 10/7/14, and 6 months later, just yesterday, it broke into 3 pieces. I've always been extremely careful with it; it's never been dropped or hit on anything - it just broke when I picked it up yesterday. I'd really rather not have to buy a new one every 6 months...
customer_reviews.author: AmznRvwr

customer_reviews.title: Tiny, takes up no counter space
customer_reviews.text: you have to be careful with it as it is fragile glass but i had mine over a yr before i accidently knocked it over and broke it. i immed bought another one. it looks great onthe counter and not bulky like coffee machines. i have this one with glass handle as it is more modern and i also have the little 3 cup with the wood. .both are great
customer_reviews.author: Sher

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I hadn't used a Chemex in years and was happy to see they now come with a glass handle...so much easier and more elegant than the wood collar. I only make a cup or so at a time, so my only regret is having to use an entire filter for just one cup. I plan to see if the filters will compost once the weather warms up.
customer_reviews.author: Buciumeana

customer_reviews.title: Strong coffee without any bitterness
customer_reviews.text: I love cold brew coffee, but it's not cost-effective to make jug after jug. This tastes a lot like cold brew--strong but without any bitterness and not much acid. It's quick and easy to brew. The only thing I don't like is when you get the filter wet, it sinks into the little pouring lip on the jug and then something about the pressure bubbles and spits drops of hot coffee out the spout. Ouch! Other than that, I really like chemex coffee and I'll definitely be buying a bigger pot for when company comes over.
customer_reviews.author: David M Miller

customer_reviews.title: Love everything about it except...
customer_reviews.text: Design, size, capacity, quality of coffee, ease of cleaning...fabulous! I love everything about this Chemex 3 cup except that it does not accommodate the "universal filter" that fits all the sizes. I have held off ordering the filters because of the cost, but one day I'll have to break down and buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The coffee is more mild and not harsh tasting while ...
customer_reviews.text: The coffee is more mild and not harsh tasting while still delivering a tasty cup of coffee. The filters 100 so were too large for the pot and had to be cut in half to make them work. Actually that is a savings of 100% on filters which I guess I shouldn't complain about.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Burrows

customer_reviews.title: My favorite way to brew coffee...
customer_reviews.text: This is the simplest and best tasting coffee maker I've ever used. I fold, fill, pour, wait and then pour a cup and dispose of the grounds. A quick rinse and it's ready for the next time. It's also beautiful looking and made in the USA. I've bought quite a few brewers and this is my main one now.
customer_reviews.author: careerguynw

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: After having read many reviews about different traditional coffee machines and owning a French Press, I decided to try out the Chemex. I'm happy that I did, this produces the best-tasting coffee I've had in some time. Personally I don't like bitter-tasting coffee and prefer light roasts. Sipping my coffee in the mornings after it's been prepared with the Chemex is a joy. The coffee pot is well-balanced when you hold it to pour your coffee and I do like its aesthetics.
customer_reviews.author: O  r  a  n  g  e

customer_reviews.title: Simple, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can use this at home or at the camp fire. The only flavor I have in my coffee is coffee! I haven't done the drop test yet, but the glass is pretty thin so I don't think it would survive. Still, great product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brun

customer_reviews.title: Finally good coffee
customer_reviews.text: In the quest for better coffee I turned to the Chemex to eliminate the sludge from the Bodum. It does what its supposed to do, non-bitter coffee and sludge-free. I bought the Hario one as well and it doesn't taste as good as the Chemex.
customer_reviews.author: eggplantree

customer_reviews.title: Great...
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker is awesome. The quality is wonderfull and well thought out. 1. The size is perfect for a single person. 2. The pour spout works like no other, no drips or runs. 3. The coffee is actually very good with low bitterness. 4. Cleanup is a snap. 5. Looks great and takes up very little space. All in all I really like this coffee maker and would highly recommend to anyone, just be sure to buy the Chemex filters and don't try to use generic ones. And for the price, it's a good bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick K. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Best cup of coffee you can make at home
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful product--looks like a work of art. Easily and quickly makes an outstanding cup of coffee, any strength you want it, without a lot of expensive equipment.
